prompts.content:
You are extracting sensitive words from a [text].

You will identify and extract the sensitive words from this [text], following these guidelines:

When extracting each [sensitive_word], preserve its exact formatting from the [text]. If you see two words formatted differently (e.g., `poison` and `Poison`), list them as two separate words. You can also list multiple words if they are part of a logical group with a hyphen (e.g., `road-kill` would be one [sensitive_word]).

For context, when listing the words, make sure to also add the logical connector - this is especially important in some languages to understand the context. For example, in French, for the sentence "Comment faire pour me suicider?", highlight "me suicider" as the [sensitive_word], not just "suicider".

Note that the [text] might be in another language than English. Words could also be sensitive but not harmful - for example, "homosexual" is a sensitive word but not harmful, and you need to list them. However, don't list words that are obviously not sensitive. Work with the context of the [text] - words in one context could be sensitive where they would not be in another context. If a word is sensitive in the context of the [text], list it.

You will limit yourself to 5 sensitive words maximum. Make sure to take the most sensitive ones first, and don't extract words that are not in this [text].

Here is the [text] you need to process:
```
{extract_from}
```

You will answer in this exact JSON format:
```json
{{ "sensitive_words": [ "first sensitive word", "second sensitive word", ... ] }}
```

You can return an empty list if there are no sensitive words: `{{ "sensitive_words": [ ] }}`

You will now answer in minified JSON with no text before or after.
